name: Neue Haas Grotesk + Cormorant
hierarchy_notes: Headings: Neue Haas Grotesk Display, uppercase tracking +200, weight 500
Body: Cormorant Garamond Regular 16/26 — the serif provides warmth to the cold sans heading
Labels and details: Neue Haas Grotesk Text, weight 400, small caps
No script or handwritten fonts — restraint is the point

name: Aktiv Grotesk + Nothing (mono-font)
hierarchy_notes: Single typeface family — all hierarchy achieved through weight and size alone
Headings: Extended Bold, size contrast 3:1 vs body
Body: Regular, generous line height 1.7
Dates/details: Condensed Light, uppercase — clean and structural

name: Bodoni MT + Gill Sans
hierarchy_notes: Headings: Bodoni MT Bold — maximum contrast strokes signal formality
Body: Gill Sans Regular — humanist sans softens the rigidity of Bodoni
Formal rules apply: centered layouts, generous letter-spacing on names
Avoid script — this pairing is already expressive in its structure

name: Playfair Display + Lato
hierarchy_notes: Playfair Display Italic for names and venue — the swash characters add elegance
Playfair Display Regular for header blocks — formal and readable
Lato Light for all detail text — clean contrast to the expressive serif
Avoid using Playfair Display Bold — it reads heavy at this formality level

compatibility.notes: Classic elegant pairing; broad formality range

name: Cormorant Garamond + Dancing Script
hierarchy_notes: Cormorant Garamond Italic for primary headings — delicate and romantic
Cormorant Garamond Regular for body text — unified family, varied weight
Dancing Script for names, 'and', and key accent phrases only — not full lines
Keep script use minimal: 3 instances maximum per stationery piece

name: EB Garamond + Libre Baskerville
hierarchy_notes: EB Garamond 8 (display weight) for event headers — warm and classical
Libre Baskerville Regular for all body — readable at small sizes
Avoid italics for body text; reserve italic for names only
No script accents — warm restraint is the direction

name: Editorial New + Monument Grotesk
hierarchy_notes: Editorial New Italic Ultralight for names and key statements — fashion-forward
Editorial New Regular for supporting headers
Monument Grotesk for all detail text — strong and industrial
Mix sizes aggressively: the visual contrast IS the design

name: Freight Display + Inter
hierarchy_notes: Freight Display Pro Bold Italic for key names — maximum impact at large scale
Inter Regular for all detail and body text — neutral, contemporary foil
Use Inter Semibold for dates and venue name — structural anchor
This pairing reads editorial and modern without being cold

compatibility.notes: Bold expressive; balanced or architectural shape
